Harry Clark Schwarts (born Harry Schwerdtjeyer, August 10, 1918 â€“ February 22, 1963) was an American professional baseball umpire who worked in the American League from 1960 to 1962. Schwarts umpired 338 major league games in his three-year career. He also umpired in the 1962 Major League Baseball All-Star Game That 1962 season, Schwarts was home plate umpire for two no-hitters: Bo Belinsky's on May 5  and Earl Wilson's on June 26. He is one of a handful of umpires to call balls and strikes for two no-hitters in one season.
Schwarts died on February 22, 1963, before the  season began. His death allowed the American League to call up 28-year old Bill Haller, who would go on to work four World Series in 20 seasons.
